articles.title: Balderdash about "northern limit line"
Joint preparatory committee meets
articles.content:
Joint preparatory committee meets
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The first meeting of the joint preparatory committee for the '99 Grand Pro-Reunification Festival and the 10th Pan-National Rally for Independence and Great Unity of the Nation (grand pan-national festival for reunification) was held in Pyongyang on July 9.
   The meeting was informed of the job done by the preparatory committees in the north and abroad since it was decided to open the August 15 grand pan-national festival for reunification and the preparations made in the south.   
   The meeting discussed in real earnest the program, contents and style of the festival this year, selection of delegates to the festival and other important matters related to preparations, and agreed on the issues placed on the agenda. 
   The meeting positively appreciated the concerted efforts made by the south headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, National Alliance for Democracy and Reunification and other reunification movement organizations to promote preparations for this year's festival  and expressed expectation that they would make good success in the days ahead.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Il praised
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Il praised
   Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) --  Palestinian ambassador to Korea Shahier Mohammed Abdlah wrote poems "Ever-shining sun" and "Great leader and great nation" in praise of the President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Il.   The poems say:   The President lives forever in the hearts of the Korean nation and millions of peoples as the sun shining forever in the space.   He is the closest friend of the people and the revolutionaries, the iron-willed commander who sent shivers down the spine of the enemy of the nation and the beacon for all the revolutionaries and freedom fighters.   Although he passed away, the Korean people are carrying through his last instructions. As the great Marshal is standing in the van of the people, their cherished desire will certainly come true.   The greatness of the nation depends on the greatness of the leader. The Korean nation is a great nation blessed with the great leaders who are just the same in terms of personality, intention and ideas.

articles.title: New moves for arms race assailed
Photo exhibition in Tokyo
articles.content:
Photo exhibition in Tokyo
   Tokyo, July 9 (KNS-KCNA) -- A U.S. cameraman in Japan held a photo exhibition in Tokyo from July 1 to 6 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung's passing away.   Put on show were photos of people laying floral baskets before the statue of the President on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang, photos taken during the Pyongyang international sports and cultural festival for peace and photos showing the features of Korea.   The cameraman said that he exhibited the photos showing the features of the DPRK to honor the memory of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Repeal of "National Security Law" demanded
articles.content:
Repeal of "National Security Law" demanded 
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for all-people solidarity action commenced one million-signature campaign for the repeal of the "National Security Law", according to the July 1st issue of  Korean newspaper Minjok Sibo published in Japan.   The organization which was  inaugurated in Seoul on June 25 is conducting the signature campaign for the repeal of the "National Security Law", the unconditional release of the prisoners of conscience and stop to the police search for political offenders on the want list, the withdrawal of the regulation of defining the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils and the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification as "enemy-benefiting organizations" and the guarantee of the non-governmental movement for reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's reminiscences released in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's reminiscences released in Nepal
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of releasing volume 6 of part 1 the anti-Japanese revolution from the President Kim Il Sung's  reminiscences "With the Century" was held in Katmandu on July 5.   The former chairman of the National Council said that the President's reminiscences is the precious textbook that should be read and studied by all people.
